A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This movie ranks No. 5 in my Star Wars Episodes filmography\, just above the prequels. It’s not better than Rogue One\, either. The film lacks a good script\, tries to run several sub stories\, but fails to concrete. The new characters do not develop in relevance\, even though it is clear that the director and producers are trying to shift the weight of the saga on them. It lacks a very important element within a lightsaber fight that all the other movies have. Some scenes and humor did not have to be there for the plot to move along. The parts that I liked\, I liked a lot. But the parts that I hated\, really spoiled the movie for me. The previous episode set very well the plot for a great follow up\, but this director fails on almost all of those points. He decided to bring in new aspects into a “universe” that was very well created and explained for 40 years. I’m not interested in watching his approach to a new trilogy. Disney can have the rights to SW\, but SW is not Mary Poppins!
